contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 9, 1862 D Enderby Jackson's 'Great National Contest' (Final)
Enderby Jackson's 'Great National Contest' (Final) 0 Test Piece Contest Enderby Jackson's 'Great National Contest' enderby-jacksons-great-national-contest
Robert le Diable [arr. Smythe]
Crystal Palace, Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK See http://www.open.ac.uk/Arts/cultures-of-brass/british-brass-band/crystal_palace_results.pdf http://www.nationalbrassbandchampionships.com/index.php?id=4
The contest was divided into two stages - the full field was split into four 'platforms' (i.e. qualifying pools), each of which performed both the set work and a selection of their own choice. Twelve bands were selected to advance to the second stage; these were Dodsworth’s of Bradford, Black Dyke, South Notts, Nottingham Saxe Tuba, Dewsbury, Keighley, Deighton, Southampton, Sutton in Ashfield, Chesterfield, Newark and Blandford.
The following bands entered the contest but did not compete.
3rd Dorset V.A.C. (Bridport) 3rd Durham V.R.C. (Bishopwearmouth) 4th Cheshire V.R.C. 11th Lancashire V.A.C. (Liverpool) 12th Lancashire V.A.C. 14th Kent V.A.C. (Woolwich) 15th Durham V.R.C. (Darlington) 20th Durham V.R.C. (Stanhope) 51st Lancashire V.R.C. Allendale Delph Saxhorn Dewsbury Borough Howlett’s (Norwich) J. W. Dodsworth's Lincoln London Irish V.R.C. Melbourne Monk Bretton Victoria Ossett Temperance Rothwell Saxhorn Wakefield V.R.C. Wednesbury V.R.C. West Hartlepool Operatic
Jan. 29, 2011, 4:43 p.m. Aug. 13, 2014, 12:55 p.m.
